register.description: This register contains the major and minor revisions for the module.

bitfield.description: TI internal data. Identifies revision of peripheral.

register.description: This contains information about the configuration of the VIM.

bitfield.description: Reserved. Reads return 0. Writes have no effect.
Indicates the number of interrupts supported by the VIM.

register.description: This register contains the number of the highest priority pending IRQ.

bitfield.description: This field indicates if the NUM field of this register is valid.
Reserved. Reads return 0. Writes have no effect.
This field indicates the priority of the pending IRQ interrupt.
Reserved. Reads return 0. Writes have no effect.
This field indicates the interrupt number of the pending IRQ interrupt with the highest priority.

register.description: This register contains the number of the highest priority pending FIQ.

bitfield.description: This field indicates if the NUM field of this register is valid.
This field indicates the priority of the pending FIQ interrupt.
This field indicates the interrupt number of the pending FIQ interrupt with the highest priority.

register.description: This register indicates which groups of interrupts have pending, unmasked IRQ interrupts.

bitfield.description: This field indicates that one or more interrupts in group M are mapped to IRQ, unmasked, and pending. Bit 0 corresponds to group 0, bit 1 corresponds to group 1, etc. The interrupts associated with each group are [(M*32)+31:M*32]

register.description: This register indicates which groups of interrupts have pending, unmasked FIQ interrupts.

bitfield.description: This field indicates that one or more interrupts in group M are mapped to FIQ, unmasked, and pending. Bit 0 corresponds to group 0, bit 1 corresponds to group 1, etc. The interrupts associated with each group are [(M*32)+31:M*32]

register.description: This register contains the 32-bit interrupt vector address of the currently pending IRQ.

bitfield.description: This field contains the upper 30 bits of the 32-bit interrupt vector address (addresses must be 32-bit aligned) of the currently pending highest priority IRQ (as indicated by the
Reserved. Read as 0. The lower 2 bits of the 32-bit vector address are always 0. (Vector addresses must be 32-bit aligned.)

register.description: This register contains the 32-bit interrupt vector address of the currently pending FIQ.

bitfield.description: This field contains the upper 30 bits of the 32-bit interrupt vector address (addresses must be 32-bit aligned) of the currently pending highest priority FIQ (as indicated by the
Reserved. Read as 0. The lower 2 bits of the 32-bit vector address are always 0. (Vector addresses must be 32-bit aligned.)

register.description: This register contains the number of the active IRQ.

bitfield.description: This field indicates if the NUM field of this register is valid.
This field indicates the priority of the active IRQ interrupt.
This field indicates the interrupt number of the active IRQ interrupt.

register.description: This register contains the number of the active FIQ.

bitfield.description: This field indicates if the NUM field of this register is valid.
This field indicates the priority of the active FIQ interrupt.
This field indicates the interrupt number of the active FIQ interrupt.

register.description: This register contains the 32-bit interrupt vector address to be used as a default in case of a DED error in any of the vectors.

bitfield.description: This field contains the upper 30 bits of the 32-bit interrupt vector address (the address must be 32-bit aligned) of an interrupt to be used if an uncorrectable double-bit error (DED) is detected in any of the interrupt vector addresses.
Reserved. Read as 0. The lower 2 bits of the 32-bit vector address are always 0. (Vector addresses must be 32-bit aligned.)

register.description: This register indicates the raw status of the events in group M. Offset = 400h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh.

bitfield.description: This is the raw status of the events in Group M.

register.description: This register indicates the masked status of the events in group M. Offset = 404h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh.

bitfield.description: This is the masked status of the events in Group M.

register.description: This register is used to enable the mask for the events in group M. Offset = 408h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh.

bitfield.description: This field is used to enable the mask of events in Group M.

register.description: This register is used to disable the mask for the events in group M. Offset = 40Ch + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh.

bitfield.description: This field is used to disable the mask of events in Group M.

register.description: This register indicates the masked status of the events in Group M that are also mapped as IRQs. Offset = 410h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh.

bitfield.description: This is the masked status of the events in group M that are mapped to IRQ.

register.description: This register indicates the masked status of the events in group M that are also mapped as FIQs. Offset = 414h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh.

bitfield.description: This is the masked status of the events in group M that are mapped to FIQ.

register.description: This register is used to map interrupts as IRQ or FIQ. Offset = 418h + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh.

bitfield.description: This field is used to indicate which interrupt the corresponding event influences (if enabled) for event group M.

register.description: This register indicates whether an interrupt is a pulse or level source. Offset = 41Ch + (j * 20h); where j = 0h to Fh.

bitfield.description: This field is used to indicate whether the source of an interrupt is a level (default) or a pulse for event group M.

register.description: This register is used to set the priority of interrupt Q. Offset = 1000h + (j * 4h); where j = 0h to 1FFh.

bitfield.description: Reserved. Reads return 0. Writes have no effect.
This is the priority for interrupt Q. If two interrupts have the same priority, then whichever interrupt has the lower number Q wins arbitration.

register.description: This register contains the vector address associated with interrupt Q. Offset = 2000h + (j * 4h); where j = 0h to 1FFh.

bitfield.description: These are the upper 30 bits of the 32-bit vector address associated with interrupt Q. It is the address that will be reflected in the
Reserved. Read as 0. The lower 2 bits of the 32-bit vector address are always 0. (Vector addresses must be 32-bit aligned.)
